item.title: Apple just killed the hackintosh
item.description: Apple announced yesterday at their event that the newest version of OS X, version 10.9 (Mavericks), will be free to all Macintosh computers that can run it. This is pretty amazing, we can finally keep all of our Macs on the same OS instead of us currently supporting three …
item.dc:creator: mr.rcollins

item.title: Multiple email addresses with one Apple ID
item.description: Apple IDs, the center of identification in the Apple universe, have the capability to attach multiple email addresses. By signing into appleid.apple.com you can verify additional email addresses. Once added you can use them with several Apple services, most notably, iMessages. Others can iMessage you with any of …
item.dc:creator: mr.rcollins

item.title: My Apple Event predictions
item.description:
Tomorrow Apple is holding an event to announce new products for the Mac. What will be announced is anyone's guess, but here's what my intuition is telling me:

  1. A new MacBook Air is pretty much a given. The rumors are pretty strong that there will be an 11.6" and …
item.dc:creator: mr.rcollins

item.title: OS X Widget to show machine name
item.description: [][]I use Apple Remote Desktop or a KVM (Keyboard/Video/Mouse) switcher to administer several OS X servers and machines. When you're working on machines in this way you can sometimes get confused on which machine you're currently controlling. If you're lucky you won't do anything stupid, but there have …
item.dc:creator: mr.rcollins

item.title: OS X not saving passwords?
item.description: About a month ago I noticed that passwords weren't being saved in apps in OS X like Safari, Omniweb, etc. I didn't bother trying to figure out the problem, until today when I would go to a site in Safari and it would ask to save the password. I said …
